item.title: Common Blood Tests Can Help Predict Chronic Disease Risk
item.description: March 17, 2017 - The creators of the risk assessment score say they want to help primary care physicians better identify patients who need extra counseling and follow-up.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 17, 2017 - The creators of the risk assessment score say they want to help primary care physicians better identify patients who need extra counseling and follow-up. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/17/520437040/common-blood-tests-can-help-predict-chronic-disease-risk

item.title: Pricey New Cholesterol Drug's Effect On Heart Disease Is More Modest Than Hoped
item.description: March 17, 2017 - The injectible drug Repatha is spectacularly good at lowering cholesterol. But the first big clinical trial of its ability to prevent heart attack and stroke finds smaller benefits.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 17, 2017 - The injectible drug Repatha is spectacularly good at lowering cholesterol. But the first big clinical trial of its ability to prevent heart attack and stroke finds smaller benefits. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/17/520516314/pricey-new-cholesterol-drugs-effect-on-heart-disease-is-more-modest-than-hoped

item.title: Texas Braces For Medicaid Cuts Under GOP Health Plan
item.description: March 17, 2017 - Advocates on both sides of the aisle say the GOP health care bill will be bad for Texas because it will lead to more people without coverage and punish the state because it did not expand Medicaid.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 17, 2017 - Advocates on both sides of the aisle say the GOP health care bill will be bad for Texas because it will lead to more people without coverage and punish the state because it did not expand Medicaid. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/17/520266060/texas-braces-for-medicaid-cuts-under-gop-health-plan

item.title: Over-The-Counter Birth Control Pills Would Be Safe For Teens, Researchers Say
item.description: March 16, 2017 - Making contraceptives available over the counter is safe, a review of research finds, and could lead to fewer unplanned pregnancies in both teens and adult women.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 16, 2017 - Making contraceptives available over the counter is safe, a review of research finds, and could lead to fewer unplanned pregnancies in both teens and adult women. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/16/520268440/over-the-counter-birth-control-pills-would-be-safe-for-teens-researchers-say

item.title: One Way To Force Down Drug Prices: Have The U.S. Exercise Its Patent Rights
item.description: March 16, 2017 - Some members of Congress say the U.S. government should use the patent rights it owns for any drugs that were developed with federal grants to drive down the prices of those drugs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 16, 2017 - Some members of Congress say the U.S. government should use the patent rights it owns for any drugs that were developed with federal grants to drive down the prices of those drugs. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/16/520390026/one-way-to-force-down-drug-prices-have-the-u-s-exercise-its-patent-rights

item.title: Trump Administration Proposes Big Cuts In Medical Research
item.description: March 16, 2017 - The National Institutes of Health, which funds research in treatments and cures, could lose 20 percent of its budget under the administration's proposal. More money would go for addiction treatment.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 16, 2017 - The National Institutes of Health, which funds research in treatments and cures, could lose 20 percent of its budget under the administration's proposal. More money would go for addiction treatment. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/16/520390147/trump-administration-proposes-big-cuts-in-medical-research

item.title: Dangers Of Opana Opioid Painkiller Outweigh Benefits, FDA Panel Says
item.description: March 16, 2017 - Opana ER has been linked to an HIV outbreak in rural Indiana among people who abuse the opioid painkiller. An advisory panel to the Food and Drug Administration says the drug is too risky.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 16, 2017 - Opana ER has been linked to an HIV outbreak in rural Indiana among people who abuse the opioid painkiller. An advisory panel to the Food and Drug Administration says the drug is too risky. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/16/520291362/dangers-of-opana-opioid-painkiller-outweigh-benefits-fda-panel-says

item.title: Travel Ban Adds Stress To 'Match Week' For Some Doctors
item.description: March 16, 2017 - A medical residency program is the next training step for newly minted doctors, and awaiting "the match" can be tense. For some international students, Trump's travel ban has made that tension worse.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 16, 2017 - A medical residency program is the next training step for newly minted doctors, and awaiting "the match" can be tense. For some international students, Trump's travel ban has made that tension worse. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/16/520137303/travel-ban-adds-stress-to-match-week-for-some-doctors

item.title: Pelosi Says Democrats Have A Responsibility To Look For Common Ground On Health Law
item.description: March 15, 2017 - House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi told NPR's Robert Siegel she doesn't think President Trump "has the faintest idea" about health care.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 15, 2017 - House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi told NPR's Robert Siegel she doesn't think President Trump "has the faintest idea" about health care. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/15/520301553/pelosi-says-democrats-have-a-responsibility-to-look-for-common-ground-on-health

item.title: 3 Women Blinded By Unproven Stem Cell Treatments
item.description: March 15, 2017 - Three patients were blinded after getting stem cells from fat at a Florida clinic. But a research study showed that induced pluripotent stem cells might someday help treat vision loss.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 15, 2017 - Three patients were blinded after getting stem cells from fat at a Florida clinic. But a research study showed that induced pluripotent stem cells might someday help treat vision loss. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/15/520118310/3-women-blinded-by-unproven-stem-cell-treatments

item.title: Former Drug Czar Says GOP Health Bill Would Cut Access To Addiction Treatment
item.description: March 15, 2017 - The director of National Drug Control Policy under President Obama, Michael Botticelli, says the proposed GOP health bill would decrease access to treatment in the middle of an opioid crisis.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 15, 2017 - The director of National Drug Control Policy under President Obama, Michael Botticelli, says the proposed GOP health bill would decrease access to treatment in the middle of an opioid crisis. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/15/520270916/former-drug-czar-say-gop-health-bill-would-cut-access-to-addiction-treatment

item.title: House Ways And Means Committee Chair Defends GOP Health Care Bill
item.description: March 15, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish talks to Rep. Kevin Brady, Republican of Texas and chair of the House Ways and Means Committee, about the GOP plan to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 15, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish talks to Rep. Kevin Brady, Republican of Texas and chair of the House Ways and Means Committee, about the GOP plan to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/15/520301560/house-ways-and-means-committee-chair-defends-gop-health-care-bill

item.title: Conservative Writer Breaks Down GOP Divisions Over Health Care
item.description: March 15, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish talks to Erick Erickson, conservative writer and radio host, about growing tension within the Republican Party when it comes to the American Health Care Act, including Breitbart's unfavorable coverage of the GOP's bill and House Speaker Paul Ryan.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 15, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish talks to Erick Erickson, conservative writer and radio host, about growing tension within the Republican Party when it comes to the American Health Care Act, including Breitbart's unfavorable coverage of the GOP's bill and House Speaker Paul Ryan. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/15/520301588/conservative-writer-breaks-down-gop-divisions-over-health-care

item.title: How Many Health Workers Have Been Killed In Syria?
item.description: March 15, 2017 - It's complicated to confirm a death. But a new study gives a minimum number of health workers who've been killed since the war began six years ago.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 15, 2017 - It's complicated to confirm a death. But a new study gives a minimum number of health workers who've been killed since the war began six years ago. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/15/520264056/how-many-health-workers-have-been-killed-in-syria

item.title: Emails Reveal Monsanto's Tactics To Defend Glyphosate Against Cancer Fears
item.description: March 15, 2017 - Internal emails show Monsanto executives scrambling to counter a U.N. agency's finding that glyphosate, the chemical in Roundup, can cause cancer. One email proposed "ghost-writing" scientific papers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 15, 2017 - Internal emails show Monsanto executives scrambling to counter a U.N. agency's finding that glyphosate, the chemical in Roundup, can cause cancer. One email proposed "ghost-writing" scientific papers. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/03/15/520250505/emails-reveal-monsantos-tactics-to-defend-glyphosate-against-cancer-fears
